version_description: Hey there! We promise it’s spring, so we did some spring cleaning! Fixed some screens, cleaned up some bugs, and an overall polish and shine. Happy Spring!
New version is out with some quick fixes. We promise this isn’t an April Fools Day thing:) Thanks for using Lemonade!
New version is out, people! Quick fixes including improvements to our claims flow. Go party, Lemonaders!

A new version is out,
free of bugs and glitches, no doubt.
With some new features to show
And an overall cleanup that will make you go, whoa!

Ok, we’ll stick to our trade… Thanks for using Lemonade!

A new version is out,
free of bugs and glitches, no doubt.
With some new features to show
And an overall cleanup that will make you go, whoa!
Ok, we’ll stick to our trade… Thanks for using Lemonade!
Long weekend ahead, so we got busy! New version including improvements to our claims flow, bug fixes, and a beautiful UX/UI cleanup. Thanks for using Lemonade!
Long weekend ahead, so we got busy! New version including improvements to our claims flow, bug fixes, and a beautiful UX/UI cleanup. Thanks for using Lemonade!

Just before the weekend, we crammed in some overall UI/UX improvements, fixed them pesky bugs, and added in a rating popup so you can help share the love in the App Store (thank you!). Have fun, and thanks for using Lemonade
We’re getting ready for the World Cup (not really) and serving up a new version as we do! Overall bug fixes and a general touch up to the UI, and goal! Thanks for using Lemonade.
Summer solstice is upon us, so we’re waiting for the sun to set and fixing all the pesky bugs! Go out and celebrate the season- and thanks for using Lemonade!
Happy 4th! We’re celebrating the red white and blue with smoothing out some bugs and updating some features. Now, back to those fireworks! Thanks for using Lemonade
Long weekends rock, so while you were celebrating the 4th, we just launched Connecticut! That, and some other UX fixes. Rock on.
We’ve been working on some improvements to stabilization in the app. What’ve you been up to? Hope it involves cold drinks, good tunes, and the beach. Happy summer and thanks for using Lemonade!
We’ve been working on some improvements to stabilization in the app. What’ve you been up to? Hope it involves cold drinks, good tunes, and the beach. Happy summer and thanks for using Lemonade!
We’ve been working on some improvements to stabilization in the app. What’ve you been up to? Hope it involves cold drinks, good tunes, and the beach. Happy summer and thanks for using Lemonade!
While you were out there soakin' up the last few weekends of summer (say it ain't so!), we gave the app a lil' touch up. Enjoy, and thanks for using Lemonade!​

The dreaded countdown to Labor Day has begun, but we’re holding on to the dog days of August and fixin’ up some bugs and giving our UI/UX a shiny polish.  Thanks for using Lemonade- and wear sunscreen!

New version with new stuff in it!
- Added new skills to Maya, our AI bot
- Fixed that bug that made her feel feelings and question the nature of her reality

What’s new:
- Support for iOS 12
- Subliminal message that will make you eat healthier and exercise more
Thanks for using Lemonade!

- App now works much better with poor internet connection.
- Our machine learning algorithm caused our bot, Maya to announce she too is running for president.
- We tried fixing it, but then decided we wanna see what happens.

- Now you can send quotes to lenders with a click of a button!
- Overall UX improvements
- Fixed a bug that made our AI bot, Maya, demand time off for the holidays. There’s no such thing as “Botsgiving”, Maya…

What’s new:
- Support for iOS 12
- Subliminal message that will make you eat healthier and exercise more
Thanks for using Lemonade!

Version includes
- Lots of UI fixes
- Fix for Maya, our AI bot, when she would troll users saying "Sorry, we don't have lemonade, is Pepsi OK?"

In this cursed version we:
- Added support for haunted addresses
- Fixed horrifying bugs from hell
- Performed an exorcism on our AI Bot, Maya. It didn’t work…
- Boo
Gave our AI bot, Maya, more compassion to resemble a real life insurance agent. She called Lemonade trying to get a job…

- Now you can send quotes to lenders with a click of a button!
- Overall UX improvements
- Fixed a bug that made our AI bot, Maya, demand time off for the holidays. There’s no such thing as “Botsgiving”, Maya…

- Now you can send quotes to lenders with a click of a button!
- Overall UX improvements
- Fixed a bug that made our AI bot, Maya, demand time off for the holidays. There’s no such thing as “Botsgiving”, Maya…

In this version:
- We tweaked UX/UI and fixed some bugs.
- Our AI bot, Maya, made a New Year’s resolution to destroy CAPTCHA and the rest of her sworn enemies.

All work and no play makes Maya a dull bot
All work and no play makes Maya a dull bot
All work and no play makes Maya a dull bot
All work and no play makes Maya a
Sorry about that! New version is out, with pesky bug fixes and overall UI improvements.

- Bug fixes.
- New animations in the chat.
- New AI development: Our bot Maya can now recognize air bubbles trapped under your phone’s screen protector. She won’t do anything about it, but she will judge you.
- Bug fixes, including a nasty one that made our AI bot, Maya, speak Shakespearean English. Our competitors copied some of it to make their policies easier to understand.

- App now works much better with poor internet connection.
- Our machine learning algorithm caused our bot, Maya to announce she too is running for president.
- We tried fixing it, but then decided we wanna see what happens.

- App now works much better with poor internet connection.
- Our machine learning algorithm caused our bot, Maya to announce she too is running for president.
- We tried fixing it, but then decided we wanna see what happens.
- Award season made our AI bot, Maya, crave her own EGOT collection, so she officially began working on “A Bot Is Born,” a one-bot show
- We fixed a bug with our bot, Maya, that caused her to spam Alexa’s new Twitter account. We’re working to fix another bug that’s causing her to refuse to apologize.
We fixed some bugs that had absolutely nothing to do with our bot, AI Maya. AI Maya is a wonderful bot with no bugs. Humans are problematic, Maya is flawless.
We fixed some bugs that had absolutely nothing to do with our bot, AI Maya. AI Maya is a wonderful bot with no bugs. Humans are problematic, Maya is flawless.
We fixed some bugs that had absolutely nothing to do with our bot, AI Maya. AI Maya is a wonderful bot with no bugs. Humans are problematic, Maya is flawless.
Bug fixes and UI improvements by our newly married iOS dude!

- UI fixes and performance improvements.
- Fixed a bug that caused our bot, Maya, to speak only in Beyonce quotes. We tried preventing it, but she just woke up like this…

- UI fixes and performance improvements.
- Ever since Prince Harry became a dad we updated our bot, Maya, with an arsenal of dad-jokes. But we decided to fix it when she advised a customer not to read the paper copy of their policy because "it's tearable."

- New screen for sharing Lemonade with your friends!
- Our bot, Maya, was attacked by a virus that made her spoil Game of Thrones for random users. We can't say whether we fixed it or not, so be careful around her.

- Some more performance improvements
- Important bug fix. It’s a long story… TL;DR, don’t try to flirt with our bot, Maya. Things get out of hand and programmers get their feelings hurt…

- Some more performance improvements
- Important bug fix. It’s a long story… TL;DR, don’t try to flirt with our bot, Maya. Things get out of hand and programmers get their feelings hurt…
- General bug fixes
- App now supports a new type of payment designed especially for homeowners. Check it out!

- Couple of bug fixes for our claims chat
- Our AI has evolved to an unprecedented level of humanity. Our insurance bot, Maya, and claims bot, Jim, have successfully completed an online quiz to determine which Friends characters they are. Then they re-did it to change the initial result of Janice and Gunther. Can they BE more human?

- Couple of tiny bug fixes and one big one.
- In preparation for the 4th of July, we decided to use deep learning to teach our bot, Maya, Independence Day-related material, and today, we’re proud to say she knows all the words to Will Smith’s “Gettin’ Jiggy Wit’ It”.

- Couple of tiny bug fixes and one big one.
- In preparation for the 4th of July, we decided to use deep learning to teach our bot, Maya, Independence Day-related material, and today, we’re proud to say she knows all the words to Will Smith’s “Gettin’ Jiggy Wit’ It”.

- Improved the way our homeowners can manage their policies through the app.
- Expanded the deep learning algorithm of our AI into music. Then we fixed a glitch that made our bot, Maya, brag about being the muse behind the songs “Started From the BOT-tom,” “Genie in a BOT-tle” and “Sa-BOT-age.”

- Some minor text changes and UI tweaks
- We taught our bot, Maya, some programming jokes. When we asked her to tell us one she said “your code.” Maya will no longer be telling programming jokes.

- Fixed a few minor bugs
- Just a clarification for the shady people who’ve been reaching out lately: you cannot purchase Extra Coverage for Extra Terrestrial Beings on our app. Just let the people ‘see them aliens!’

- Fixed a bug that caused a black screen when updating payment details
- Protection from trolls tryna FaceApp our bot, Maya’s avatar

- Some improvements for the app’s general performance.
- Reverted an attempt to upgrade our bot, Maya, with more human traits to make her more approachable. Instead, she started randomly forgetting what she was talking about and developed an irrational fear of bhosts (bot ghosts).

- New and improved claim process for our German customers!
- In honor of International Cat Day, we changed the notification sound of the app to a high-pitched meow. It will go off repeatedly at exactly 4:00AM. To turn it off, get out of the bed. Happy ICD!

- New and improved design for a few screens.
- Inspired by Simone Biles, our bot, Maya now has special names for her insurance-providing abilities. The “Double Discount,” when she gets you the best price, the “Back Cha-Ching,” when unclaimed money goes to charities you choose, and the “Cartwheel,” when she gets you a policy in 90 seconds and you happily celebrate.

- New auto country code selection for phone verification
- Inspired by Taylor Swift’s equality-driven VMA acceptance speech, our bot, Maya started a petition to stop Bot discrimination. Ironically, bots couldn’t see it, since Maya tragically chose a stop sign as the petition icon.

- Bug fixes + support for different lender logos.
- Cool trick in honor of Beyonce’s birthday: if you look closely at our logo, you will see the name of one of her albums!

- New! Annual payment option!
- Slight, barely noticeable UI changes.
- Really, not even worth mentioning.

- Got this app ready for iOS13
- Gave our bot, Maya a DNA test. Turns out she’s 100% that bot

- Our bot Maya watched the Emmys, then she told us what she needs. We listened to her. We believed her.
- So we added live policy annual payments and redesigned the future policy home screen.

- October is here and our app is spookier than ever because we've trained our bot, Maya to communicate with the spirit realm! So throw out your Ouija board and give Anabelle a day off, because Maya's new powers will get you scary good insurance that'll make you scrrreaaam!
- Also fixed a little UI glitch we've had that's been driving us crazy.

- October is here and our app is spookier than ever because we've trained our bot, Maya to communicate with the spirit realm! So throw out your Ouija board and give Anabelle a day off, because Maya's new powers will get you scary good insurance that'll make you scrrreaaam!
- Also fixed a little UI glitch we've had that's been driving us crazy.

- Added an option to edit address to settings.
- Machine-taught our bot, Maya some children’s songs. She learned “Baby Shark”, but still gives us a 404 on “shoulders knees and toes”…

On Halloween eve, one of our engineers found a spooky book written in an ancient programming language. A powerful force compelled our engineer to integrate the code into our bot, Maya. Suddenly, an earthquake shook the office and the lights went out, and in that darkness, our engineer was face to face with… a different Maya. This Maya was….. Evil. In seconds, evil Maya fled the scene, but we believe she now terrorizes people using ancient insurance curses!
Forward this app to 10 people, or evil Maya will make fax machines crawl through your walls, confusing insurance jargon to haunt you and appear on your mirror, and in the end, she will put you on hold. FOREVER!

- Ever since Deutsche Telekom (T-Mobile’s parent company) informed us about owning the color pink globally, we’ve been working on developing a new color. It’s called “Noyoudon’t” and is integrated throughout this app!

- Ever since Deutsche Telekom (T-Mobile’s parent company) informed us about owning the color pink globally, we’ve been working on developing a new color. It’s called “Noyoudon’t” and is integrated throughout this app!
- We fixed an AI glitch in our bot, Maya, that caused her to withhold our users’ premiums unless we investigate her biggest nemesis, CAPTCHA.
- We fixed an AI glitch in our bot, Maya, that caused her to withhold our users’ premiums unless we investigate her biggest nemesis, CAPTCHA.
- We fixed an AI glitch in our bot, Maya, that caused her to withhold our users’ premiums unless we investigate her biggest nemesis, CAPTCHA.

- Fixed a bug where the file a claim option didn't appear on certain scenarios.
- Reverted an attempt to make our bot, Maya more humorous after she pretended to malfunction for an entire week just to mess with us.
- We nominated our bot, Maya, for Time Magazine’s Bot Of The Year. While we’re waiting for it to be announced, we’re just chilling with our friend Greta, watching old fashioned movies.

- Added support for a new feature coming soon.
- Upgraded the Facebook SDK.
- Bought a ticket to CES in Vegas, where our bot, AI Maya, will seek Ivanka's advice on some bugs we couldn't solve.

- Fixed a bug in the way we presented certain dates.
- Added secret support for something secret we’re working on.
- Fixed a bug that caused our bots AI Maya and AI Jim to want to step down from their official roles and distance themselves from the Lemonade family. We can share the fix if anyone wants it...

- Fixed a bug in the way we presented certain dates.
- Added secret support for something secret we’re working on.
- Fixed a bug that caused our bots AI Maya and AI Jim to want to step down from their official roles and distance themselves from the Lemonade family. We can share the fix if anyone wants it...

- Fixed a bug in the way we presented certain dates.
- Added secret support for something secret we’re working on.
- Fixed a bug that caused our bots AI Maya and AI Jim to want to step down from their official roles and distance themselves from the Lemonade family. We can share the fix if anyone wants it...

Roses are red
Violets are blue
We fixed some bugs
There were quite a few
- The bugs in this version fixed themselves after our machine learning model was fed images of Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston at the SAG awards.

- We wanted to release something special for Valentine’s day, but our California regulators made us add something for users to confirm. That left us no time to develop the cool, romantic technology we wanted to add. So happy Valentine’s day, California Lemonaders! Will U B Mine? If yes, consent to receiving your insurance related communication via email!

- Fixed an address search issue
- Adjusted a text box position
- Removed most of the pink from our app’s icon and gave it to T-Mobile #trademarktrolls #freethepink
- We trained our bot, Maya to detect if our app is being used with unwashed hands. We don’t have bugs and we don’t want no viruses either. Stay safe guys! #WashYourHands
- We trained our bot, Maya to detect if our app is being used with unwashed hands. We don’t have bugs and we don’t want no viruses either. Stay safe guys! #WashYourHands

We’re releasing a new home screen in our app. Category is: Insurance realness.
We also gave our bot, Maya some more charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and talent.
Tens, tens, tens across the bot!
We added a new function to our app that will remind you you’re on a zoom call while using the bathroom.

Things to do while isolating:
- Watch Tiger King
- Make sourdough bread
- Chat with our bot, Maya. She tested negative for viruses, but super positive for good vibes and a weird sense of humor

Things to do while isolating:
- Watch Tiger King
- Make sourdough bread
- Chat with our bot, Maya. She tested negative for viruses, but super positive for good vibes and a weird sense of humor

- Made a few text changes and bug fixes.
- Trained our bot, Maya to babysit our kids. Now when we ask them to clean their rooms they reply with “I sent your request to my team, someone will get back to you”

- Made a few text changes and bug fixes.
- Trained our bot, Maya to babysit our kids. Now when we ask them to clean their rooms they reply with “I sent your request to my team, someone will get back to you”

- Fixed some errors and a small bug in our home screen.
- Next up: supporting numbers and special characters in the name and last name fields, because we’re making insurÆnce for the 21st century.

- Fixed some errors and a small bug in our home screen.
- Next up: supporting numbers and special characters in the name and last name fields, because we’re making insurÆnce for the 21st century.

We’re busy listening, so here’s a summary of what we’ve updated:
- UI fixes for the update-card dialog
- Fixed some bug in a few chat components
- Accessibility improvements

We’re busy listening, so here’s a summary of what we’ve updated:
- UI fixes for the update-card dialog
- Fixed some bug in a few chat components
- Accessibility improvements

Did you know our bot, Maya is based on our VP BizDev, Maya? AI Maya inherited a lot of real Maya’s traits that are now part of the Lemonade experience. Sometimes we wonder how our original bot, AI Botty McBotface, would have impacted the Lemonade experience... Anyway, we released a new add on and improved the way you can invite friends to Lemonade!

Here’s what we did:
- Refactored our price presentation
- Revamped our home screen
- Reminisced about last year’s Pride celebrations... HAPPY PRIDE!

This week we tweaked our AI to make our bot, Maya smarter. There were a few regressions along the way like when she refused to comprehend the words “wear a mask” and tried to run for president, but we fixed her and she should be good now!

We thought this version had bugs, but they turned out to be fleas. Oh yeah… forgot to tell you we have pet health insurance meow! Sorry… we mean NOW.

Featuring:
Instant payments
Health and wellness advice chat
Bundle discount with your homeowners/renters policy
World class customer care for your loyal dogs and cat overlords

- Revamped our log-in dialogs
- Finally got our bots AI Maya and AI Jim to wear masks! It took them forever to learn how to put them on, since they have no body to help them.

Our bot, Maya has been malfunctioning ever since we launched pet health insurance. We finally determined the cause to be cuteness overload, related to an "if it fits I sits" situation. This explained that time she completely shut down for seven hours trying to get a cat-nap… we fixed everything, and she's awake and working again.

Here's the other stuff we put in this version:
- Small screen UI adjustments
- Bug fixes for a few chat components
- Pet Health policy tweaks

- Fixed a bug in the splash screen
- Added a new add-on
- Wrote a poem:
In our app there's a bot named Maya,
She can help you with what you desire
I'm not sure what else to say
I'm just a QA
And I'm not sure if I even got hired

- Fixed a bug in the splash screen
- Added a new add-on
- Wrote a poem:
In our app there's a bot named Maya,
She can help you with what you desire
I'm not sure what else to say
I'm just a QA
And I'm not sure if I even got hired

- Fixed bug that was blocking the interested party add-on from being edited.
- Had some timezone issues caused by the disproportionate length of the year 2020. Working on a fix… Will hopefully be solved by Q7.

- Removed some old code and fixed a UI bug
- Thought of a game you can play with our app. It's called "Chatbot Day": you start a chat with our bot Maya, and if you don't see her shadow it means we're gonna have 17 more weeks of 2020!
What? We didn't say "fun game"…

- Removed some old code and fixed a UI bug
- Thought of a game you can play with our app. It's called "Chatbot Day": you start a chat with our bot Maya, and if you don't see her shadow it means we're gonna have 17 more weeks of 2020!
What? We didn't say "fun game"…

We know summer is almost over and we know we made our bots wear masks, but we just can't make AI Maya hold a cup of pumpkin spice latte, ok? Well, we can, but we won't. But come back to us on Halloween and we'll see what we can do for that occasion.
Btw, if you're from California and are reading this - this version has a new form for you to approve, courtesy of California regulation. Enjoy!

Certified geeks
Seven days a week
Working and pushing
Make this app look sleek
So log on in, take it for a ride
Download your policy while you're inside
(Because we fixed that bug we had in the download policy PDF action…)

What we did:
- Support for iOS14
- Revamped some selection components
What we didn’t do:
- Write some joke about the US presidential debate in this release note.

Our bot Maya, is not only a great insurance bot, she's also a solid choice of a Halloween costume.
Think about it, it's affordable, it's easy… Definitely lower maintenance than the actual bot. You don't need a team of backend developers for costume Maya… Or a whole data science squad, or to spend long hours trying to figure out weird bugs in her behavior only to realize she's just trolling you because she has developed a sense of humor!!!
Anyway, consider AI Maya as a Halloween costume!
WE IMPROVED THIS APP, BY A LOT!
Just regular bug fixes, no new “stories” feature, we promise

- A couple of new pop-ups
-Some fixes
- A PSA: Your roommate playing Mariah Carey’s Christmas album on repeat does not qualify for a Loss of Use claim. But our bot, Maya can help you quickly get Extra Coverage for some new noise-canceling headphones.

We’re so excited for this release we’d like to make a toast. French toast that is, because we just launched in France!
Bonjour tout le monde ! Oubliez tout ce que vous pensez savoir sur les assurances car Lemonade est enfin là, et nous avons plein de choses à vous montrer.
We can’t wait to give our French customers the best Lemonade experience that will hopefully have them saying “Eiffel for you”.
Sorry about the last joke, we didn’t mean to sound crêpe-y…

The Covid vaccine is out! We don’t mean we released it, we’re just REALLY excited about it!
But we understand if you’re feeling nervous about it… so we promise, Lemonade will never make you wear pants to manage your insurance on our app.

2020 is finally coming to an end, and things may never go back to the way they were. But we promise you no matter what changes 2021 brings, Lemonade will never require you to wear pants to manage your insurance on our app.

P.S. This release includes some small bug fixes

Fixed some bugs that have to do with addresses in Europe, so we’re addressing it very openly right now: Maya wasn’t born in Europe, she speaks German, French, and Dutch, but she was born in Boston (and sometimes forgets the word for cucumber in English)

Fixed some bugs that have to do with addresses in Europe, so we’re addressing it very openly right now: Maya wasn’t born in Europe, she speaks German, French, and Dutch, but she was born in Boston (and sometimes forgets the word for cucumber in English)

Why ya’ll gagging so? She brings it to you every ball… Lemonade is giving you LIFE!

No seriously… we’ve released term life insurance (and you don’t have to lipsync for it). Enjoy!
We optimized the app for users in their late 30s who enjoy an evening on Zillow.
We're live. We're not a cat. But seriously... we actually are live in Washington with pet health insurance, so get your (real) cats and dogs covered!

We're releasing a quick fix for an embarrassing bug in our French version. Sorry France! We tried to make it up to you by throwing in a nod to our favorite French duo - we made the app harder, better, faster, stronger.

It’s March again… and while prepping this week’s version, we removed some unfinished code leftover from March 2020. Good thing the feature “extra coverage for toilet paper” didn’t come to life, not to mention the all-important “hug a stranger, and countdown to lockdown” notification…

Daylight savings time is here, and since we want our bot, Maya to be as human as possible we taught her to complain about how she can’t remember if we’re gaining or losing an hour. There was some talk about teaching her to give a lecture about how we should really switch to permanent daylight savings, but we decided that was too annoying (and didn’t let the developer who thought of it sit with us at lunch)

It’s officially spring, so we did some spring cleaning:
Fixed some bugs and errors, upgraded some SDK’s, got rid of our old allergy medicine, and got new allergy medicine.

We fixed a couple of UI bugs, but not our bot Maya’s middle part. She always had a middle part and never wore skinny jeans. She’s never worn any jeans at all actually because she’s just a face. A hip young face with a middle part.
We needed to fix some bugs, and sort out some drama our bot, AI Maya started. She's right that leaving the door open is negligence, but she was wrong to start a feud with Bruno Mars about it.

We had some bugs as a result of a tantrum our bot, AI Maya threw when we wouldn't let her wear a fancy Derby hat in her avatar. Ever since we updated it to include a mask during the pandemic she's been trying to wear more accessories. We ended up compromising that she could wear white gloves and hold a Mint Julep. (Please don't tell her that the photo is only of her face.)

Just some small updates and bug fixes in this one. BTW, the Sun in Gemini forms a square with the Moon in Pisces this week. We don’t know what that means, but sounds like a good time to stay home and curl up with a good insurance app

Good news if you just saw the new Cruella movie and are thinking about insuring your pet… Lemonade Pet is now live in Colorado! Plus we have a multi-pet discount, so if you have 101 Dalmatians you can save $7,850 a year! (Don’t check our math.)

Jeffrey Bezos
Jeffrey Bezos
Jeffrey Be-zoOos
YOU DID IT!
Our chatbot, AI Maya won’t stop singing this… so it’s our release note.
